abstract: Appraisal of late Oakland Raiders owner Al Davis asserts that he lived up to the label of maverick until his death; holds that Davis never seemed to care what anybody thought about how he ran his team or how he conducted himself, but for all his antics, he made a profound impact on football beyond the three Super Bowls the Raiders won.
snippet: Al Davis never seemed to care what anybody thought about how he ran his team or how he conducted himself.
lead_paragraph: Al Davis never seemed to care what anybody thought about how he ran his team or how he conducted himself.

headline.main: Davis Lived Up to the Label of Maverick Till His Death
headline.print_headline: Davis Lived Up to the Label Of Maverick Till His Death
headline.seo: Al Davis Was a Maverick Until His Death
